s.text: (Re Saddam: note that the Clinton administration is now confronted with a serious "Wag the Dog" problem: any strong action taken against Saddam may be construed in the media as a manufactured diversion.)
(The paper also oh-by-the-ways that Clinton acknowledged under oath for the first time that he did indeed have an affair with Gennifer Flowers.)

The story was first broken by late editions of yesterday's Washington Post and LAT . ("Today's Papers" was castigated by numerous readers for having poor news judgment, or worse, a pro-Clinton desire to suppress news.
